intro: Neurotropis platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited neurotropis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature common in the Rubiaceae family. Neurotropis platycarpa is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and undergrowth.
